Question: What must you do if glass falls on to the road from your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Sweep it up straight away if you can do so safely

Question: What is shown by a white reflector (cat’s eye) placed on the road?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: You can be fined if your vehicle is on a road and not up to warrant of fitness standard.
If you tow another vehicle, what is the maximum distance allowed between the two vehicles?
What is the speed limit from the time you pass an Accident sign until you are past the crash site?
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: A rest area is 70 metres ahead
Do not stop for the next 70 metres

Question: What must you do when you hear a siren or see red flashing lights from an ambulance or fire engine?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get out of the way
Pull over and allow it to pass

Question: Which person can legally stop and do a roadside check of your vehicle?
Which parts of the car must be in good condition to prevent too much noise and gases entering the car?

Answers.Answer: Good mud guards and mud flaps
A good silencer and exhaust system

Question: You MUST dip the headlights on your vehicle when:

Answers.Answer: changing lanes in a one way street
changing lanes to exit the motorway

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Can you stop on a bus stop in a private motor vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Only if it is for less than 5 minutes

Question: For what purpose can a vehicle use the flush median strip?

Answers.Answer: To move into the traffic flow

Question: Your vehicle has a current warrant of fitness but a rear red brake light (stop light) is not working. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Only use the vehicle during daylight hours
Only use the vehicle in a 50km/h speed zone

Question: What colour is the line painted on a sealed road at a Give Way sign?
What is the least distance of clear road you MUST have in front of you when you have finished passing another vehicle?
What must be displayed on the back of a trailer being towed at night?
You must turn your headlights on when visibility is less than:
You may use a right turn bay to overtake a vehicle travelling straight ahead.
What should you do if the vehicle behind you wishes to pass?

Answers.Answer: Move to the centre so that they cannot pass
Speed up so that they will not need to pass
Move as far to the left side of the road as is safe

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Alcohol slows down your reactions when driving.
What does ‘the speed limit’ mean?

Answers.Answer: The slowest speed you can drive in good conditions
The fastest speed you can drive in good conditions
The average speed you can drive in good conditions
The fastest speed you can drive, except when overtaking

Question: What must you do at an intersection controlled by a Stop sign?

Answers.Answer: Slow down and be prepared to stop
Stop only if you can do so safely
Continue driving unless you can see an oncoming vehicle

Question: In addition to checking it is safe to move out from the kerb into the traffic flow, what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Accelerate quickly into the traffic flow
Move slowly into a space in the traffic flow

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What is the maximum speed you may drive if you have a ‘space saver wheel’ fitted?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When driving into bright sunlight, you should use sunglasses and your vehicle sun visors for safety. What else are you advised to do?

Answers.Answer: Turn the headlights of your vehicle on
Drive safely on the far left of the road
Look at and drive close to the centre of the road
Pull over or stop and wait for a few minutes

Question: What should you do when following another vehicle in wet conditions?

Answers.Answer: Drive closer to the vehicle so that you can follow in its tracks
Drive with your vehicle handbrake on

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When coming to a pedestrian crossing with a raised traffic island in the middle, what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to pedestrians who are on your half of the road
Give way to pedestrians on the other side of the road
Remain stopped until the pedestrian has reached the other side of the road
Drive on as pedestrians will give way to all on coming traffic

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: There has been a crash – slow down to 20km/h when passing this sign until you have passed the crash
There have been crashes here in the past – slow down
There has been a crash – but the road is clear now
